title: About Me
text:
My name is Dillon Sparks and I am an aspiring data scientist with a focus in data storytelling and using data to promote educational equity. This website is meant to share my professional mission, academic accomplishments, professional endeavors, and hobbies/interests. I carefully curated this space (using Quarto and R Markdown) to give prospective employers and friends a peek into different areas of my life.


Columbia University, School of Engineering and Applied Sciences | New York, NY | M.S in Data Science | Aug 2022 - Dec 2023
Georgetown University | Washington, DC | B.S in Mathematics | Sept 2017 - June 2021



R Forwards- R Foundation taskforce on women and other under-represented groups | Consultant | Remote| Feb 2024 - present
Columbia University Department of Statistics | Staff Associate II | New York, NY| Apr 2024 - May 2024
Columbia Women’s Basketball Team | Data & Analytics Team Member | New York, NY| Aug 2022 - Apr 2024
J.P Morgan Chase, Artificial Intelligence Research Team | Data & Analytics Summer Associate | New York, NY| Jun 2023 - Sep 2023
Bridge to Enter Advanced Mathematics | College Support Coordinator | New York, NY | Jul 2021 - Apr 2022
Georgetown University Center for Social Justice | After School Kids (A.S.K.) Program: Youth Justice Committee Coordinator | Washington, D.C. | May 2019 - May 2021



JPMorgan Columbia University Data Science Institute Master’s Diversity Fellowship (https://datascience.columbia.edu/news/2022/meet-the-class-of-2024-dillon-sparks-uses-data-to-promote-educational-equity/)
Lena Landeggar Community Service Award (https://studentaffairs.georgetown.edu/landeggerserviceawards/)
Lisa Burgoa (SFS ’19) Award (https://csj.georgetown.edu/celebration/)
